title: How to Make a Delicious Thick Pancake

steps.headline: Gather your ingredients listed above.
steps.description: You can alter the amounts of ingredients above if you like. This recipe can work any way and cooking is about experimenting anyway, right! Some people like a not-so-sweet pancake so they tend to take down the sugar content, but it is completely up to you!

steps.headline: Add your flour, sugar, eggs and milk into a large bowl.
steps.description: Use an electric whisk to stir the ingredients as this is both easy, quick and the right technique to get that lovely, airy thickness in your pancake. Place the whisk aside as we will be using it again later. If the mix looks too thin, add a little more flour.

steps.headline: Add in the cream of tartar and bicarbonate of soda.
steps.description: This will be what makes your pancakes rise! Whisk this in as well and after a while you should get your pancake batter!

steps.headline: Take out a frying pan.
steps.description: You can also use a pan intended for making pancakes, which would be even better! With a small ladle, spoon some of your mixture into the pan. It is hard to say how much you want in because people have certain preferences on their pancake-size, so do it to whatever size you want. For a medium-sized THICK pancake, cook for about one minute on one side and a little bit less on the other side. Add and take some time from the cooking depending on your pancake-size and thickness. Both sides should be a light golden brown.

steps.headline: Once you have used up all your pancake batter, you can now spread whatever you want on it.
steps.description: You can stick to butter and jam or use maple syrup or a coulis of some sort. You can even chop up some bananas or strawberries to put on top. The decision is up to you. After you have done this, there is only one thing left to do... eat it!
